dismissalText.long: c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi 99 (116b 9x4 0x6) SR: 85.34

dismissalComment.html: gone, that's beautifully bowled! Mushfiqur falls one short of what would have been a magnificent hundred. Fullish outside off, and again he gets it to nip away off the track, against the angle. Looks to drive it with an open face, and only manages an edge through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Hasan Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hasan Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c & b Hasan Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Mithun c & b Hasan Ali 60 (84b 4x4 0x6) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: caught and bowled! Back of a length on off, and this is too close to his body. He slogs rather uncomfortably, and takes a leading edge. The ball's in the air for a while, and Hasan Ali runs forward towards the batsman, and then takes the easiest of catches. Mithun falls after a fighting innings.

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Soumya Sarkar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar headshot

dismissalComment.html: out for a duck on comeback, and that's very well bowled. He's been bringing him forward with his lengths so far, and he digs this one in short, and outside off stump. Gets it up to shoulder height, and Soumya is in no position to control his pull. Ends up skying it and offering a simple catch to square leg. Mohammad Amir has been struggling for wickets, and his replacement strikes in his second over

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh my, what a delivery that is! This is what any left-arm quick going round the wicket dreams of seeing. Perfect length, pitching on off stump and straightening past the outside edge to hit top of off. Not too much Liton could have done about it - maybe take a bigger stride forward in defence?

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Again, he goes full, angling in towards off stump. Isn't quite a yorker, and that works against Mehidy as he looks to flick this over midwicket. Not full enough to force him to play along the ground, too full to give him the elevation to get it over the fielder, and in the end he offers him a chest-high catch

headshotImage.caption: Mahmudullah headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mahmudullah headshot

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Length ball angling into off stump, and perhaps Mahmudullah was better served looking to hit down the ground. Went across the line instead - midwicket was inside the circle - and ended up missing completely. That's four for Junaid now. He's been utterly brilliant today

headshotImage.caption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mominul Haque headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mominul Haque headshot

dismissalComment.html: and he follows up with a beaut and beats Mominul for pace! Back of a length, pitches outside off and nips back in off the track, skids off the wicket and Mominul is late bringing his bat down in defence. Didn't really matter, because it would have beaten his inside edge anyway. Cannons off the back pad and leaves his off stump spinning. Pakistan's left-arm quicks are on fire here

dismissalText.long: lbw b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes lbw b Shadab Khan 9 (10b 1x4 0x6) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: full on middle stump, and skidding straight through! Kayes is on the back foot, and the ball hits his front leg as he tries to defend. Shadab appeals and the umpire raises his finger. Kayes asks Mushfiqur about reviewing but the senior batsman tells him to walk back. Smart choice, one reckons.

dismissalText.long: run out (Hasan Ali)
dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Hasan Ali) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Oh dear, that's a terrible way to get run out.Length ball on off stump, looks to clear his front leg and flat-bat to long-off. The bowler moves to his left and cuts the ball off, and the batsmen still look to steal a quick single. Bit of a brain fade, and the bowler simply has to jog to the stumps and flick the bails off

dismissalText.long: c Fakhar Zaman b Hasan Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Fakhar Zaman b Hasan Ali 13 (13b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: and that's that. Back of a length slower ball on off stump, Mashrafe makes himself room as always, and goes for the big hit down the ground. The boundaries here are massive, and there's no way he's clearing that man at long-on

dismissalText.long: st Litton Das b Mahmudullah
dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq st Litton Das b Mahmudullah 83 (105b 2x4 1x6) SR: 79.04

dismissalComment.html: Oh dear, he's gone down the wicket! Length ball, but wide outside off stump. Imam's halfway down the track, and the ball is too far away from him. Deceived by the seam-up arm ball, and Liton Das displays some excellent glovework

dismissalText.long: st Litton Das b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Asif Ali st Litton Das b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 31 (47b 3x4 0x6) SR: 65.95

dismissalComment.html: ooh, that's superb glovework to follow a beauty of a delivery. Classic offspinner's dismissal, lovely flight outside off and it's the one that drifts away slightly and continues along that trajectory after pitching. Draws Asif forward, makes him reach for the ball, and in the process causes him to lift his back foot out of the crease. Liton collects and removes the bails in one motion, and Bangladesh are back on top once more

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Babar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Babar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: big shout for lbw! And given. Full on middle and leg, and the ball skids straight through. Babar tries to defend from near his pads, but the ball stays low and hits his front back leg. Imam suggests Babar shouldn't review. He's walking back. Impact was in front of off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Sarfaraz Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Sarfaraz Ahmed headshot

dismissalComment.html: edged to the keeper! Full outside off, and angling further away. Sarfraz tries to drive this away from his body, but the ball takes the feather-edge and the catch is gobbled by the diving keeper to his right. Excellent work in the field by Bangladesh thus far. Another failure for Sarfraz

headshotImage.caption: Hasan Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hasan Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: back of a length on off, and he swings hard towards the leg side. But he's toe-ended this shot, and the skyer is comfortably taken at mid on running to his left

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nawaz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nawaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: holes out to deep midwicket A gentle length ball angling into his body, and he tries to pull this over the mid-wicket boundary. Hits it well, but not well enough. The substitute keeps his calm near the boundary

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Fakhar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fakhar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full and wide outside off, and he drills this straight to mid on! This is hit very hard but Rubel throws himself into the air, and the ball sticks in his hand! Another failure for Fakhar. This is an extraordinary catch. Fakhar looks shellshocked after using his feet to get to the delivery's pitch.

commentTextItems.html: full just outside off, and carefully defended off the front foot to cover point. Bangladesh win by 37 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: 11.57pm Hope you enjoyed our coverage. We know our finalists, and now all we need to know is who will be crowned Asia's champion. That, we shall learn on friday, so see ya'll then? On behalf of all of us at ESPNcricinfo, this is Sreshth Shah signing off! Have a good night.
11.52pm Time for the presentation.

Mushfiqur Rahim, the Man of the Match: "It was important I kept belief in myself. And Mithun batted brilliantly too. I told him that we need to dig in after the early wickets. Credit goes to the way I practice and my preparation. That gives me confidence. I'm taking the right decisions more often."

Mashrafe Mortaza, the winning captain: "I think we changed our combination a bit. Usually I open the bowling, but today we started with Miraz. The bowlers did a good job, especially when we didn't get the runs. But Mushi and Mithun batted really well. We can be proud of our fielding today. Long time we haven't seen this quality of fielding in our time, so hopefully the boys can understand the value of good fielding. We still need to improve a bit of our batting and bowling. I was lucky that I didn't drop my catch, because Shoaib Malik was in such good form, but all over the fielding was really good. We always know that India are a serious side. We don't have Shakib and Tamim but hopefully the boys can show their character on friday."

Sami: "Saw a friendly tournament for a change! Lots of positives to take from players and fan behaviors towards each other. Love for cricket is strong as ever in our subcontinent! Love from Bangladesh. "

Rohan Trehan: "Mushfiqur may be MOTM but lets not forget Mithun's contribution. I believe his innings was the difference as no other Pakistan batsman's score was even close to Imam's. He didn't have enough support."

Sarfraz Ahmed, the losing captain: "Not feeling good, but the performance wasn't good. As a captain, I didn't do well. So I think as a team and as a captain, I didn't lead well. We didn't field well, our batting collapsed and as a team we didn't do well in any department. Fakhar was our main player, Shadab and Nawaz had opportunities, but we need to play well if we need to win against good teams. Our batting collapse hurt us. Shaheen is our plus point."

11.40pm It's yet another India-Bangladesh final at the Asia Cup! The result might show that it was a 37-run victory for Bangladesh, but Pakistan, led by Imam and Asif, fought hard for the most part. Both teams suffered early with the bat, with the pacers taking wickets up front to rattle batting orders, but eventually it will be Mushfiqur's 99 that will stand out on the scorecard. That innings was the difference today. The Bangladesh fans are delighted. BCB chief Nazmul Hassan congratulates his boys.

doctor: "shoaib malik has already proved a pathetic captain and sarfaraz took the team to the top.after misbah. one shouldnt forget the disasterous situation of team from where sarfaraz took the team. few players needs replacement fawad alam instead of asif ali and team is good "
Abhishek Verma: "This felt same as the English going on and on about "It's coming back" for the Football world Cup. Never count your eggs before they hatch.. "

Imrul: "BD deserves to be in the final. They lost their best batsman Tamim in the 1st match, lost Shakib before today's virtual semi-final. Still they beat every team bur India. AFG played well, Kudos to them. But you have to win your matches, which they did not..."
ORPHIUS: "Congratulation Bangladesh for making it to Final. And Kudos to them - they made it without their two best player Tamim and Sakib."

Uzair: "I seriously believe it is time for Mickey Arthur to go. He has just not understand the level an type of cricket we play. Imagine Mickey asking Saeed Anwer to bat a certain way or asking Wasim Akram to bowl a certain way. I don't see players are getting the independence they need to show their talent. "
Chinmay: "@Imran - With all due respect. The recent past you are talking about is Zimbabwe and West indies. If they want to live in that reality good for them. "

I can guarantee you that these guys in the Pakistani dressing room must be feeling worse than any of us watching the game. Whoever is talking about making changes to the team at this stage doesn't know cricket or understand it. we need to stick with these guys till the world cup, they have shown their capabilities in the recent past. Its just a matter of time till the turn it around, whatever needs improvement they should work on it."

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Fakhar Zaman c Rubel Hossain b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 1 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: full and wide outside off, and he drills this straight to mid on! This is hit very hard but Rubel throws himself into the air, and the ball sticks in his hand! Another failure for Fakhar. This is an extraordinary catch. Fakhar looks shellshocked after using his feet to get to the delivery's pitch.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam lbw b Mustafizur Rahman 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: big shout for lbw! And given. Full on middle and leg, and the ball skids straight through. Babar tries to defend from near his pads, but the ball stays low and hits his front back leg. Imam suggests Babar shouldn't review. He's walking back. Impact was in front of off stump.

dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 10 (7b 2x4 0x6) SR: 142.85

dismissalComment.html: edged to the keeper! Full outside off, and angling further away. Sarfraz tries to drive this away from his body, but the ball takes the feather-edge and the catch is gobbled by the diving keeper to his right. Excellent work in the field by Bangladesh thus far. Another failure for Sarfraz

dismissalText.long: st Litton Das b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Asif Ali st Litton Das b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 31 (47b 3x4 0x6) SR: 65.95

dismissalComment.html: ooh, that's superb glovework to follow a beauty of a delivery. Classic offspinner's dismissal, lovely flight outside off and it's the one that drifts away slightly and continues along that trajectory after pitching. Draws Asif forward, makes him reach for the ball, and in the process causes him to lift his back foot out of the crease. Liton collects and removes the bails in one motion, and Bangladesh are back on top once more
